intro: Fagara pendjaluensis, commonly known as the Cameroon mountain pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the highland regions of Cameroon and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by dark blue berries. Fagara pendjaluensis is adapted to cool, humid climates and is often found in montane forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of scientific interest.
